{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3353078,"name":"Sofia","username":"kvitka","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/3e96dc/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-05T20:45:44.532Z","cooked":"

Hi. I am working on a mechanical engineering capstone project and am a novice when it comes to programming and wiring motors. Our goal with our motor is to spin a mass with two fast zones and two slow zones within one rotation. We are using a 36:1 gear box with our motor to reduce the RPM. Fast zones are around 120 RPM and slow zones are about 20 RPM for shaft rotations (after it is outputted from the gear box).

Here are all of the components my team is using to program our motor:
motor - neo brushless 1.1 (from rev robotics)
motor controller
we are using an arduino uno rev 3 for microcontroller

Here is the link to the example code I found so that we can code our Alternate Encoder and get data to successfully implement PID control using the Motor Controller.

Does anyone know how to download the libraries that it requires? I’m having trouble finding them online. Also, I am unsure what #include(, <stdtint.h>) and #pragma once means.

image1094×324 30.1 KB

If anyone has any suggestions, please let me know! Thanks, much appreciated (also sorry for not linking the motor, for some reason the site only lets new users add two links into their first post… ill try to comment all the links to the components)

The code you’re looking at is for the FRC competition using the roboRIO with CAN. Rev Robotics does not provide a Arduino library. You can control the Spark Max over PWM and read the through bore encoder on the arduino and run your control algorithm on the arduino.

Thank you for your response! Ah, I see my error. We are using PWM to control the Spark Max and to spin the motor itself. We were using an ESP-32 but then our advisor recommended to switch to Arduino. Do you have suggestions on how to read the counter bore encoder through the Arduino? I am having trouble setting up libraries and functions.
